src.preprocess package¶

Submodules¶

src.preprocess.base module¶

class src.preprocess.base.BasePreProcessor(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: object

Base for all pre-processor classes. The preprocessing classes are responsible for taking the raw data exports and normalizing them so that they can be ingested by the feature engineering class. This involves: - subsetting the ROI (default is Kenya) - regridding to a consistent spatial grid (pixel size / resolution) - resampling to a consistent time step (hourly, daily, monthly) - assigning coordinates to .nc files (latitude, longitude, time)

data_folder: Path, default: Path(‘data’)

The location of the data folder.

static chop_roi(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, subset_str: Optional[str] = 'kenya', inverse_lat: bool = False) → xarray.core.dataset.Dataset¶

lookup the region information from the dictionary in src.utils.region_lookup and subset the ds object based on that region.

get_filepaths(folder: str = 'raw') → List[pathlib.Path]¶
static load_reference_grid(path_to_grid: pathlib.Path) → xarray.core.dataset.Dataset¶

Since the regridder only needs to the lat and lon values, there is no need to pass around an enormous grid for the regridding.

In fact, only the latitude and longitude values are necessary!

merge_files(subset_str: Optional[str] = 'kenya', resample_time: Optional[str] = 'M', upsampling: bool = False) → None¶
regrid(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, reference_ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, method: str = 'nearest_s2d') → xarray.core.dataset.Dataset¶

Use xEMSF package to regrid ds to the same grid as reference_ds

ds: xr.Dataset

The dataset to be regridded

reference_ds: xr.Dataset

The reference dataset, onto which ds will be regridded

method: str, {‘bilinear’, ‘conservative’, ‘nearest_s2d’, ‘nearest_d2s’, ‘patch’}

The method applied for the regridding

static resample_time(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, resample_length: str = 'M', upsampling: bool = False) → xarray.core.dataset.Dataset¶

src.preprocess.chirps module¶

  • merge into one time (~500MB)

class src.preprocess.chirps.CHIRPSPreprocesser(data_folder: pathlib.Path = PosixPath('data'))¶

Bases: src.preprocess.base.BasePreProcessor

Preprocesses the CHIRPS data

static create_filename(netcdf_filepath: str, subset_name: Optional[str] = None) → str¶
chirps-v2.0.2009.pentads.nc

=>

chirps-v2.0.2009.pentads_kenya.nc

dataset = 'chirps'¶
preprocess(subset_str: Optional[str] = 'kenya', regrid: Optional[pathlib.Path] = None, resample_time: Optional[str] = 'M', upsampling: bool = False, parallel: bool = False, cleanup: bool = True) → None¶

Preprocess all of the CHIRPS .nc files to produce one subset file.

subset_str: Optional[str] = ‘kenya’

Whether to subset Kenya when preprocessing

regrid: Optional[Path] = None

If a Path is passed, the CHIRPS files will be regridded to have the same grid as the dataset at that Path. If None, no regridding happens

resample_time: str = ‘M’

If not None, defines the time length to which the data will be resampled

upsampling: bool = False

If true, tells the class the time-sampling will be upsampling. In this case, nearest instead of mean is used for the resampling

parallel: bool = True

If true, run the preprocessing in parallel

cleanup: bool = True

If true, delete interim files created by the class

src.preprocess.utils module¶

src.preprocess.utils.select_bounding_box(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, region: src.utils.Region, inverse_lat: bool = False, inverse_lon: bool = False) → xarray.core.dataset.Dataset¶

using the Region namedtuple defined in engineering.regions.py select the subset of the dataset that you have defined that region for.

: ds (xr.Dataset)
the data (usually from netcdf file) that you want to subset a bounding

box from

: region (Region)

namedtuple object defined in engineering/regions.py

: inverse_lat (bool) = False

Whether to inverse the minimum and maximum latitudes

: inverse_lon (bool) = False

Whether to inverse the minimum and maximum longitudes

: ds (xr.DataSet)

Dataset with a subset of the whol region defined by the Region object

src.preprocess.vhi module¶

  • Add lat lon coordinates

  • add time coordinates

  • subset Kenya

  • merge into one time (~500MB)

Create a new dataarray for the variable from ds with geocoding and timestamp

create_new_dataset(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, longitudes: numpy.ndarray, latitudes: numpy.ndarray, timestamp: pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp, all_vars: bool = False) → xarray.core.dataset.Dataset¶

Create a new dataset from ALL the variables in ds with the dims

dataset = 'vhi'¶
static extract_timestamp(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset, netcdf_filepath: str, use_filepath: bool = True, time_begin: bool = True) → pandas._libs.tslibs.timestamps.Timestamp¶

from the attrs or filename create a datetime object for acquisition time.

NOTE: the acquisition date is SOMEWHERE in this time range (satuday-friday)

USE THE FILENAME

preprocess(subset_str: Optional[str] = 'kenya', regrid: Optional[pathlib.Path] = None, parallel: bool = True, resample_time: Optional[str] = 'M', upsampling: bool = False, cleanup: bool = True) → None¶

Preprocess all of the NOAA VHI .nc files to produce one subset file with consistent lat/lon and timestamps.

Run in parallel

subset_str: Optional[str] = ‘kenya’

Region to subset. Currently valid: {‘kenya’, ‘ethiopia’, ‘east_africa’}

regrid: Optional[Path] = None

If a Path is passed, the VHI files will be regridded to have the same grid as the dataset at that Path. If None, no regridding happens

resample_time: str = ‘M’

If not None, defines the time length to which the data will be resampled

upsampling: bool = False

If true, tells the class the time-sampling will be upsampling. In this case, nearest instead of mean is used for the resampling

parallel: bool = True

If true, run the preprocessing in parallel

cleanup: bool = True

If true, delete interim files created by the class

static print_output(outputs: List) → None¶
save_errors(outputs: List) → pathlib.Path¶
